{{Orphan|date=October 2008}}
{{Orphan|date=October 2008}}
'''Johnnie Walters''' (fl. late 20th century) is a [[Canada|Canadian]]-born broadcaster and television personality known for his on-air improvisation and sense of humour. He is best known for his long affiliation with [[CKCO-TV]] in [[Kitchener, Ontario]].
'''Johnnie Walters''' (fl. late 20th century) is a [[Canada|Canadian]]-born broadcaster and television personality known for his on-air improvisation and sense of humour. He is best known for his long affiliation with [[CKCO-TV]] in [[Kitchener, Ontario]].
â
[[Image:JohnnieWalters1.jpg|thumb|Johnnie Walters doing a promo for CKCO-TV]]
+
He received his training on American TV and radio, developing his style hosting TV shows in U.S. cities. According to [[Harold Ramis]] in [[Dave Thomas (actor)|Dave Thomas]]'s book, ''SCTV: Behind The Scenes'', the [[Second City Television|SCTV]] "Dialing For Dollars" spoofs were based on the show of that name hosted by Walters in [[St. Louis, Missouri|St. Louis]].
He received his training on American TV and radio, developing his style hosting TV shows in U.S. cities. According to [[Harold Ramis]] in [[Dave Thomas (actor)|Dave Thomas]]'s book, ''SCTV: Behind The Scenes'', the [[Second City Television|SCTV]] "Dialing For Dollars" spoofs were based on the show of that name hosted by Walters in [[St. Louis, Missouri|St. Louis]].
